solution_line_template: Since each year have {days_per_year} days, the total amount of money Sally will save in a year is ${sally_daily_savings}/day * {days_per_year} days/year = $<<{sally_daily_savings}*{days_per_year}={sally_yearly_savings}>>{sally_yearly_savings}/year

The total amount of money Bob will have saved in a year is ${bob_daily_savings}/day * {days_per_year} days/year = $<<{bob_daily_savings}*{days_per_year}={bob_yearly_savings}>>{bob_yearly_savings}/year
In total, Sally and Bob would have saved ${bob_yearly_savings} + ${sally_yearly_savings} = $<<{bob_yearly_savings}+{sally_yearly_savings}={total_saved}>>{total_saved}
